page.title: 16Children's Games
page.content: Each day at school we go out to play. In the playground a range of games take place. We found that most of the younger boys and girls played with each other whereas the older children played with children of the same sex. The younger children acted out their favourite television programmes such as the 'A Team' and 'Airwolf'. The older children played 'Tag' and 'Ticky Tunnels'. Some of the girls practisced gymnastics and the older boys played football pretending to be Liverpool players as this seemed to be the favourite team. There was some evidence that traditional singing games were sometimes played and girls were seen skipping. Conkers were played in the autumn with a complicated set of rules.
